Title: Ehlers-Danlos Syndrome
Summary: Ehlers-Danlos syndrome is a group of inherited connective tissue disorders characterized by skin hyperelasticity, joint hypermobility, and blood vessel fragility. There are thirteen subtypes, with varying prevalence and symptoms, and diagnosis is based on clinical findings and genetic testing. Management focuses on preventing complications, with an emphasis on patient education and multidisciplinary care.

Title: Ehlers-Danlos Syndrome (EDS) and interoception - The Fascia Hub
Summary: Ehlers-Danlos Syndrome (EDS) affects interoception, leading to difficulties in pain recognition, autonomic regulation, digestion, and temperature control. Title: Variants in the Kallikrein Gene Family and Hypermobile Ehlers-Danlos Syndrome
Summary: Variants in the Kallikrein gene family, particularly KLK15, are implicated in Hypermobile Ehlers-Danlos Syndrome (hEDS), with whole exome sequencing revealing a significant genetic contribution and functional studies in mice demonstrating related connective tissue defects.

Title: The role of medical cannabis in EDS
Summary: Medical cannabis has shown significant benefits for Ehlers-Danlos syndrome patients, alleviating chronic pain and reducing reliance on opioids. It interacts with the endocannabinoid system, potentially improving symptoms across multiple domains, including fatigue and sleep issues. Early evidence suggests it may also support mitochondrial function, contributing to its effectiveness. Caution is advised when introducing cannabinoids due to patient sensitivity.

Title: Pulsatile Tinnitus: Interventional Neuroradiologists Offer Answers and Relief
Summary: Pulsatile tinnitus, a rare form of tinnitus characterized by rhythmic sounds in sync with the heartbeat, can indicate underlying vascular issues.
